node.title: Chinese tech giant Alibaba fires employee who claimed sexual assault
node.description: The employee, identified only as Ms. Zhou, went public in August with allegations that she was raped by a colleague on a business trip.

node.title: "Doomsday glacier" ice shelf could shatter within 5 years, scientists say
node.description: Researchers said the entire glacier holds enough water to raise sea levels by more than two feet.

node.title: Kentucky on My Mind
node.description: On states that bite the hand that feeds them.

node.title: People Scoop Spilled Gas to Use at Home Following Truck Explosion That Killed Over 50
node.description: This is the latest in a string of nationwide hardships, including a fuel shortage, 7.2 magnitude earthquake, and a presidential assassination--all in 2021.

node.title: 9 Years After Sandy Hook, Oxford Shooting Sees Parents Prosecuted in Unprecedented Move
node.description: The charges against Ethan Crumbley's parents "is a major marker that may provide an example to other prosecutors," Michael McAuliffe told Newsweek.

node.title: Some Kroger Employees Without COVID Vaccine to Pay $50 a Month Surcharge On Health Plan
node.description: Kroger said that unvaccinated managers and non-union workers on the company health care plan will pay a $50 monthly surcharge starting January 1.

node.title: Instacart Driver Accused of Running Over Groceries After Seeing Customers' Pro-Police Sign
node.description: According to a police statement, the driver has been identified and will likely face charges "in the near future."

node.title: Internet Divided Over Redditor 'Not Respecting' Boyfriend's Religious Mom's Rules
node.description: The woman said she was surprised when her boyfriend's mother would not let them sleep in the same room despite them living together abroad.

node.title: Ex-NFL player who killed 6 people had CTE, autopsy finds
node.description: Authorities say former NFL player Phillip Adams fatally shot six people in South Carolina before killing himself in April.

node.title: Famed for Fiction, Jim Harrison Was Also a Poet of Prodigious Appetites
node.description: Pleasure and mortality are the twin themes of Harrison’s mammoth “Complete Poems,” spanning his career from his 1965 debut to his 2016 death.

node.title: Top 10 New York Dishes of 2021
node.description: As restaurants began to emerge from pandemic lockdowns, Pete Wells was often drawn to superlative versions of classic dishes.

node.title: New York’s Top 10 New Restaurants of 2021
node.description: After a year that began with indoor dining banned in the city, our critic Pete Wells cherishes the places that celebrate sharing — and life.

node.title: ‘The Royal Tenenbaums’ at 20: When Wes Anderson Imagined New York
node.description: The film’s vision of the city is at once entirely made up and very real seeming, both dated and contemporary. But the movie couldn’t outrun current events.

node.title: South Africa Data Shows Omicron Can Evade COVID Vaccine, Shots Prevent Hospitalization
node.description: People who received two shots of the Pfizer vaccine had 33 percent protection against becoming infected with the variant, according to an analysis.

node.title: China Calls U.S. a 'Saboteur' in Asia
node.description: China's Foreign Ministry responded after Secretary of State Antony Blinken raised concerns about Beijing's "aggressive actions" in Asia.

node.title: Internet Slams Broke Man Buying Video Game Instead of Wife's Christmas Gift
node.description: A librarian has revealed her husband, who is "reluctant to work," couldn't buy her a gift as he spent his money on a video game.

node.title: Belarus Opposition Leader's Husband, 5 Others Sentenced to At Least 14 Years in Prison
node.description: Siarhei Tsikhanouski, the husband of Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya, previously ran against current President Alexander Lukashenko in 2020's elections.

node.title: Baby Timber Rattlesnake Found in Arizona, as Far as 2,500 Miles From Home
node.description: The snake was not released into the wild but will be used as part of an educational outreach program.

node.title: Govt must consider environment in budget process more - Watchdog
node.description: The environment watchdog says the government's budget process needs to be improved to take better care of the environment.

node.title: Gore District Council and iwi sign off on 'future-focused' Charter of Understanding
node.description: The Gore District Council and Hokonui Rūnanga have signed a Charter of Understanding to collaborate for the good of the community.

node.title: Covid-19 pandemic response 'clearly tailored to Pākehā' - Māori Council
node.description: Māori now make up about half of all cases in the Delta outbreak, despite making up just 16 percent of the population.

node.title: Heavy rain causing disruption across country
node.description: Flooding has led to road closures, caused sewage overflows and bad weather has helped cancel 60 flights at Wellington Airport. Other regions are bracing for intensified downpours. Video

node.title: 2 Pfizer doses 70% effective against Omicron hospitalization, data show
node.description: Preliminary analysis of the latest real-world data from South Africa shows that while two shots of the vaccine alone may not stop an infection, it will help avoid serious illness.

node.title: Pardon backlog frustrates thousands seeking to clear their names
node.description: "Everywhere I go there will be background checks and I don't want that to be a hindrance for my future," one woman says.

node.title: The Best Cookbooks of 2021
node.description: A deep dive into the world of grains, a collection of new cookie classics, unforgettable recipes from Shanghai and more, as tested by New York Cooking and the Food desk.

node.title: Workers at two Boston-area Starbucks seek to unionize after a win in Buffalo.
node.description: The filing with the National Labor Relations Board on Monday could reflect a rising interest in organizing by workers elsewhere.

node.title: Democrats Set Debt Limit Increase at $2.5 Trillion Ahead of Senate Vote
node.description: The figure would allow the government to continue borrowing to finance its obligations without further action by Congress until after the 2022 midterm elections.

node.title: Scientists Use Extreme Stars to Test the Limits of Albert Einstein's Greatest Theory
node.description: Physicists tried for 16 years to find flaws in Albert Einstein's ground-breaking theory of general relativity, which is the best description of gravity we have.

node.title: Fearing Border Closure After Presidential Election, Migrants Coming to Chile in Droves
node.description: Many migrants are treating the Dec. 19 runoff presidential election as the deadline for when to cross over, fearing an anti-immigration candidate could win.

node.title: U.S. Banks Collected $6.13B in Overdraft Fees Over 9 Months, Yet Many Are Eliminating Them
node.description: Banks collect overdraft fees when customers pay or withdraw more money than they have in their account.
